data.subject: Eggs
data.message:
Recent article in Men's Health was touting the goodnes of eggs.  It noted that you can't beat eggs when it comes to breakfast. Each large egg holds 6.3 grams of high-quality protein and a powerhouse load of vital nutrients.

 

  • A study published in the International Journal of Obesity found that people who replace carbs with eggs for breakfast lose weight 65 percent quicker. 
  • Researchers in Michigan were able to determine that regular egg eaters enjoyed more vitamins and minerals in their diets than those who ate few or no eggs. 
  • By examining surveys from more than 25,000 people, the researchers found that egg eaters were about half as likely to be deficient in vitamin B12, 24 percent less likely to be deficient in vitamin A, and 36 percent less likely to be deficient in vitamin E. 
  • And here’s something more shocking: Those who ate at least four eggs a week had significantly lower cholesterol levels than those who ate fewer than one. Turns out the dietary cholesterol in the yolk has little impact on your serum cholesterol.

So eggs are good for you.  What are you waiting for go on and scrabble a couple....

data.subject: Time for Breakfast...champion!
data.message:
Nice sized bowl of bran flakes (you can sub for another high fiber, low sugar cereal)

3 or 4 spoons of plain yogurt 

Low fat milk.

Blueberries

A nice drizzling of maple syrup (please no substitutes!)

 

Delicious and nutritious too!

data.subject: Huevos Racheros
data.message:
Classic Mexican breakfast

 

Cooking time 5 mintues

Yield two servings

1/3 cup refried beans

Water to taste

1 tablespoon butter

4 eggs

Salt and pepper to taste

4 crispy corn fried tortillas, whole

¼ cup (1 ounce) grated anejo cheese

1 cup red roasted tomato salsa, warmed

¼ cup of cilentro leaves, coarsely chopped

  1. Reheat the refried beans in a small skillet over low heat, adding a little water until the beans are the consitency of apple sauce
  2. Heat in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat and add the butter.  Break the eggs into the skillet and seaon with salt and pper.  Cover and cook for 1 minute or until done to taste.  Remove from heat.
  3. Place two tortillas on each plate and coat with a thin layer of refired beans.  Sprinkle each with half the cheese.
  4. Top each tortilla with and egg and ladle on the warmed salsa
  5. Sprinkle the remaining cheese and cilantro.  Serve immediately

What some added heat?  We recommend Tabasco brand Chipotle sauce.

Enjoy.
